title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Balloon Tensions Escalate
Ukrainians Demonstrate Training on Leopard Tanks in Poland
description: The soldiers began training on advanced Western tanks three weeks ago. Poland’s president says the tanks will be crucial to Ukraine’s war efforts.

title: Week After Turkey-Syria Earthquake, Relief Efforts Are Stymied
description: A week after a powerful quake struck Turkey and Syria, the combined death toll surpassed 35,000. With more than a million homeless in Turkey alone, there is a desperate need for temporary housing.

title: They Were Told Their Building Was Earthquake Safe. It Collapsed Anyway.
description: Some structures promoted as being built to modern seismic codes did not withstand the quake in Turkey. One upscale tower that fell may have had a design flaw, engineers said.

title: Ukraine Plans to Meet With I.M.F. Officials to Get More Funding
description: Officials from Kyiv are said to be traveling to Warsaw this week to discuss billions of dollars in aid to close the fiscal gap created by the war.

title: Netanyahu’s Judicial Overhaul Sparks Huge Protests in Israel
description: As Benjamin Netanyahu’s government pressed ahead with plans to limit judicial influence, Israelis thronged to unusually large rallies.

title: One Week After Turkey-Syria Earthquake, Relief Efforts Stymied
description: More than 31,600 people in Turkey and more than 3,500 in Syria have died in the earthquake, the deadliest in Turkey since 1939.

title: Panel Finds Decades of Abuse in Catholic Church in Portugal
description: More than 500 people have come forward to say they were abused by representatives of the church, and a new report says the number of victims may surpass 4,800.

title: The Next Phase in Ukraine
description: The war in Ukraine is entering a new phase. We explain each side’s strategy.

title: ‘Our Losses Were Gigantic’: Life in a Sacrificial Russian Assault Wave
description: Poorly trained Russian soldiers captured by Ukraine describe being used as cannon fodder by commanders throwing waves of bodies into an assault.

title: Russia tightens a claw around Bakhmut, as Wagner fighters claim another village.
Russia tightens a claw around Bakhmut, as Wagner fighters claim another village.
China Says U.S. Balloons Entered Its Airspace Over 10 Times Since 2022
description: The claim followed a weekend of aerial theatrics, with Washington and Beijing spotting unidentified flying objects in their airspaces.

title: China’s Top Airship Scientist Said He Sent One Over North America in 2019
description: Corporate records and media reports reveal an airship scientist at the center of China’s high-altitude balloon program. Companies he has founded were among those targeted by Washington.

title: How Teens Recovered From the ‘TikTok Tics’
description: A wave of teenagers who developed tics during the pandemic has receded, illustrating the powerful influence of stress on the body and the resilience of adolescents.

title: Webb Telescope Spots a Distant Spiral Galaxy Like Our Own
description: LEDA 2046648 has an eerie resemblance to our Milky Way galaxy, but it likes a billion light-years away.

title: Cambodia’s Leader Shuts Independent News Outlet Ahead of Election
description: The leader, Hun Sen, was not satisfied with an apology he received from the outlet after it wrote about his son, a lieutenant general.

title: How China’s ‘Gateway to Europe’ Began to Narrow
description: The Czech Republic, which once courted Beijing in the hope of attracting investment, has soured on China, as have many other countries in Central and Eastern Europe, partly over the war in Ukraine.
